        "advisory": {
          "id": "RUSTSEC-2025-0018",
          "package": "xmas-elf",
          "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection. As a result, a malformed ELF file could trigger out-of-bounds reads in\na consumer of the HashTable API by setting these fields to inappropriately large\nvalues that would fall outside the relevant hash table section, and by\nintroducing correspondingly out-of-bounds hash table indexes elsewhere in the ELF\nfile.",
          "date": "2025-03-26",
          "aliases": [],

          "package": "linkme",
          "title": "Fails to ensure slice elements match the slice's declared type",
          "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T. For example, elements of type `&&str`\ncould end up in a slice of type `[&str]`, since `&&str` coerces to `&str` via a\nderef coercion.\n\nThe flaw was corrected by implementing typechecking for distributed slice\nelements in such a way that coercion no longer occurs. The element's type must\nbe a subtype of the slice's declared element type.",

          "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection.           "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection.           "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T. For example, elements of type `&&str`\ncould end up in a slice of type `[&str]`, since `&&str` coerces to `&str` via a\nderef coercion.\n\nThe flaw was corrected by implementing typechecking for distributed slice\nelements in such a way that coercion no longer occurs.           "id": "RUSTSEC-2025-0018",
          "package": "xmas-elf",
          "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection. As a result, a malformed ELF file could trigger out-of-bounds reads in\na consumer of the HashTable API by setting these fields to inappropriately large\nvalues that would fall outside the relevant hash table section, and by\nintroducing correspondingly out-of-bounds hash table indexes elsewhere in the ELF\nfile.",

        "advisory": {
          "id": "RUSTSEC-2024-0407",
          "package": "linkme",
          "title": "Fails to ensure slice elements match the slice's declared type",
          "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T. For example, elements of type `&&str`\ncould end up in a slice of type `[&str]`, since `&&str` coerces to `&str` via a\nderef coercion.\n\nThe flaw was corrected by implementing typechecking for distributed slice\nelements in such a way that coercion no longer occurs. The element's type must\nbe a subtype of the slice's declared element type.",

          "id": "RUSTSEC-2025-0018",
          "package": "xmas-elf",
          "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection. As a result, a malformed ELF file could trigger out-of-bounds reads in\na consumer of the HashTable API by setting these fields to inappropriately large\nvalues that would fall outside the relevant hash table section, and by\nintroducing correspondingly out-of-bounds hash table indexes elsewhere in the ELF\nfile.",

          "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T. For example, elements of type `&&str`\ncould end up in a slice of type `[&str]`, since `&&str` coerces to `&str` via a\nderef coercion.\n\nThe flaw was corrected by implementing typechecking for distributed slice\nelements in such a way that coercion no longer occurs.           "package": "xmas-elf",
          "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection. As a result, a malformed ELF file could trigger out-of-bounds reads in\na consumer of the HashTable API by setting these fields to inappropriately large\nvalues that would fall outside the relevant hash table section, and by\nintroducing correspondingly out-of-bounds hash table indexes elsewhere in the ELF\nfile.",

          "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T.           "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection. As a result, a malformed ELF file could trigger out-of-bounds reads in\na consumer of the HashTable API by setting these fields to inappropriately large\nvalues that would fall outside the relevant hash table section, and by\nintroducing correspondingly out-of-bounds hash table indexes elsewhere in the ELF\nfile.",

          "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T. For example, elements of type `&&str`\ncould end up in a slice of type `[&str]`, since `&&str` coerces to `&str` via a\nderef coercion.\n\nThe flaw was corrected by implementing typechecking for distributed slice\nelements in such a way that coercion no longer occurs.           "package": "xmas-elf",
          "title": "Potential out-of-bounds read with a malformed ELF file and the HashTable API.",
          "description": "Affected versions of this crate only validated the `index` argument of\n`HashTable::get_bucket` and `HashTable::get_chain` against the input-controlled\n`bucket_count` and `chain_count` fields, but not against the size of the ELF\nsection. As a result, a malformed ELF file could trigger out-of-bounds reads in\na consumer of the HashTable API by setting these fields to inappropriately large\nvalues that would fall outside the relevant hash table section, and by\nintroducing correspondingly out-of-bounds hash table indexes elsewhere in the ELF\nfile.",

          "description": "Affected versions allow populating a DistributedSlice of T with elements of an\narbitrary other type that coerces to T. For example, elements of type `&&str`\ncould end up in a slice of type `[&str]`, since `&&str` coerces to `&str` via a\nderef coercion.\n\nThe flaw was corrected by implementing typechecking for distributed slice\nelements in such a way that coercion no longer occurs.
